results.title: The Ridge
results.creator_credit: Two-Up Films, Film Victoria, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Angela Borelli and Janet McLeod
results.brief_description: Outback New South Wales there’s a town where dreams can either be made or broken - a place that is harsh and dusty and sometimes unforgiving to those who dig its soil for the elusive gem that will hopefully one day make them rich. Lightning Ridge is one of Australia’s better-known opal fields, rich in history and highly regarded for its unique black opal. This documentary film follows the daily routine of some of those miners who have made the “Ridge” their home, and through their personal stories we learn just how dedicated and determined they can be in the belief that one day they will find the “big one”. Opal mining can be tedious, exciting or just plain hard work but at the Ridge, a town where men outnumber women by six to one, there is a shared camaraderie that unites the community, regardless of who you are or where you come from.

results.title: The Rideau: Colonel By's peaceable waterway
results.creator_credit: International Cinemedia Centre, Joseph Koenig, George Kaczender and Marc Champion
results.brief_description: A look at the history of the Rideau Canal — its original military purpose, its painstaking contruction between 1826 and 1831, its effects on the land around and on Canada as a whole. The film combines old drawings and actual footage, contemporary commentary and voices from the past, to reveal the technological and human sides of one of Canada’s greatest engineering achievements.

results.title: The Ride
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low and Gerald Potterton
results.brief_description: A slapstick comedy in the manner of the old favourites directed and acted in by Gerald Patterson, who plays chauffeur to a partly eccentric business tycoon. Filmed in the winter playground of the Laurentians; the tycoon has a fondness for tobogganing and reading his financial news at the same time; inevitably he takes a headlong plunge downhill on a runaway sled with the chauffeur in hot pursuit.

results.title: The Riddle of the Dead Sea Scrolls
results.brief_description: Based on the recently completed, controversial studies of Australian biblical scholar, Dr Barbara Thiering, which explodes miracles and other elements of the New Testament. Did the virgin birth really happen? And did Jesus actually create the miracles…turning water to wine and feeding the 5,000 with two fishes and five loaves? “The Riddle of the Dead Sea Scrolls” challenges the Gospels and the events they describe - until now believed by billions of Christians as sacrosanct. Jesus Christ is presented as a spiritual and political revolutionary whose mission was to transform Judaism. Shot in Israel, the Middle East and Europe, against a background of conflict in the region, the program is a compelling story of controversial issues both timely and universal. Every person who’s ever heard of Jesus will want to see it… every Christian should.

results.title: The Riddle
results.creator_credit: Helicon Audio Visual, Lower East Side Information and Service Center for Narcotic Addiction, William Jersey and Barbara Connell
results.brief_description: In a pool room in downtown New York, down and outers are playing pool - some are sniffing cocaine and the theme song “Some are going to win, some are going to lose” is playing. This film is about drug addiction with the main story focusing on one particular addict, his habits, his pyschological and physiological state and the doctor who is attempting to rehabilitate him. A poignant story.

results.title: The Rhino War
results.brief_description: In Africa, the war to save the black rhino is reaching a bitter climax. Armed poachers have swept through East Africa slaughtering the rhino for its valuable horn, bringing the animal perilously close to extinction. In an unprecedented conservation measure, Zimbabwe game rangers now guard Africa’s black rhino population with the government’s permission to shoot poachers on sight. Both man and beast are dying in this tragic conflict, the enemies being greed, corruption and ignorance.
